data.title: Amazon invests in cloud computing initiative, hopes to teach 29 million people by 2025
data.text: CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team discusses Amazon's new cloud computing initiative and its intent to teach the technology to millions of people by 2025, with Teresa Carlson, Amazon's vice president for the worldwide public sector.

data.title: Amazon's (AMZN) 26 Projects to Bolster Carbon Neutrality Efforts
data.text: Amazon (AMZN) announces 26 new utility-scale wind and solar energy projects, which will be located in the United States, the U.K., Australia, France, Germany, Italy, South Africa and Sweden.

data.title: Why Loup Ventures' Gene Munster says to be more selective about which FAANG stocks you own
data.text: Mega-cap tech companies led the market higher through most of 2020. Is it time for the next generation of growth stocks to take the lead?

data.title: BP to Deepen Ties With Amazon by Supplying More Renewable Energy
data.text: Based on the long-standing relationship, BP is set to supply cleaner energy to Amazon (AMZN) and in return, the Seattle, WA-based firm will facilitate the British energy major's digital transformation.

data.title: Amazon Aims To Upskill 29 Million In Cloud Computing
data.text: Amazon Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) disclosed plans to retrain 29 million people globally in cloud-computing skills by 2025. As a part of the effort, Amazon will offer cloud computing training events using current AWS designed programs and newly developed courses.
